meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'orb': having the most spherical shape.
meanings.sent1: The basketball was the orbiest object on the court.
meanings.sent2: The moon looked orbiest when it was full and round in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The orbiest snowball hit me right on the head!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like the orbiest pearls, shining with brightness.
meanings.sent5: The crystal ball was the orbiest thing I had ever seen, perfectly round and clear.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of 'orb': having the most spherical shape.
meanings.sent1: The Earth is the orbiest planet in our solar system.
meanings.sent2: The crystal ball was the orbiest of all the decorations in the room.
meanings.sent3: She wore the orbiest hat at the party, drawing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The orbiest pearl in the necklace gleamed under the light.
meanings.sent5: The orbiest balloon at the fair was so perfectly round, it seemed to defy gravity.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'orb': relating to or characteristic of the orbit of a celestial body.
meanings.sent1: The orbiest path of the comet fascinated astronomers.
meanings.sent2: The satellite followed the orbiest trajectory around the planet.
meanings.sent3: The orbiest dance move in the routine made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His mind was in the orbiest state, lost in thoughts of the stars.
meanings.sent5: The orbiest motion of the planets in the sky was a mesmerizing sight.
